title: Around the Districts : Aughrim , Carnew , Coolgreany and Tinahely
body_text:
Around the Districts: Aughrim, Carnew, Coolgreany and Tinahely
AUGHRIM
Yoga Classes with Yvonne
New 6 week courses have commenced at Aughrim Sports Complex - Mixed level class on Mondays at 9.30am and Wednesdays at 8pm. Beginners class on Wednesdays at 6.45pm. All classes are also live-streamed and a recording of the class is provided if you’ve signed up and you miss a class. Classes will go ahead provided there are sufficient numbers. Please get in touch with Yvonne on 087 6778733 to enquire/book or visit yvonnedoyle.com
Town & Country Market
There are a lot of marketeers with fantastic products and produce offerings from barista coffee, fresh biscuits, home baked cakes, artisan breads, frittatas and sausage rolls, plus freshly made garlic pesto, handmade clothing for babies, flower arrangements to beautify homes and workplaces. We have wooden products and hand painted signs, bird boxes and natural healing products plus hand crafted cushions and hand-crafted jewellery and cards. Artisan bread and home bakes plus a beautiful setting to enjoy with the whole family and even to bring along the dog for a walk. The playground is a fantastic place for the little ones while the New to you Thrift shop offers bargains of all kinds for the whole family. The fishing facility is open and stocked so if fishing is your passion this is the place to be. Bowling green is looking stunning, chat to any member for more information.
Please see @aughrimtownandcountry on Facebook for weekly updates or contact Linn on 087 6836278 if you want to become a Marketeer or need any information regarding the market. We look forward to seeing you all on Saturday between 10am and 1.30pm. And if you are not sure where to find us, put Y14WK38 into your google maps and it will bring you right to our front door.
Notes Deadline
Items to be included in the Aughrim notes should be emailed to aughrimnotes@gmail.com before 8pm on Sundays. Do not send attachments.
CARNEW
GAA Lotto
Carnew GAA lotto was not won numbers were 11,12,19,22, lucky dips were Mick Kelly and David Gregan, the next draw is 13th January and the jackpot is €5,700.
Bingo
The next drive in bingo is on Sunday 19th January at 2pm in Carnew mart.
GOAL Mile
We are pleased to announce that the 10th Tinahely GOAL Mile (not the 9th as previously published!) has so far raised a fantastic €702 through online registrations and on the day donations. Thank you for your ongoing support of GOAL Global’s humanitarian work across the world.
Thank you to Sam and Colin Horan, from Murphy’s Hotel Tinahely, for their ongoing generosity in hosting the event and providing refreshments afterwards.
Special thanks also to Maeve Tallon and other members of Tinahely Comhaltas Ceoltoiri Eireann (CCÉ) for organising the musical entertainment.
It was a true community event.
Table Quiz
Kit Kenny will once again be hosting a table quiz in aid of a childrens centre in Kenya on Friday 10th January at 8pm in Askamore Community Centre Y25F6D8. A raffle with loads of prizes will be held on the night. All proceeds are in aid of Nadirkonyen Street Childrens Centre in Kenya.
New Year, New You
Four nights of stimulating talks will take place in January 2025 in Askamore Community Centre
Night 1: Tuesday January 7th at 7.30pm. Bishop Ger Nash: Kindness; Susan Byrne McDonald (Dietician) Lets get the Diet right; Ann Cushin: (Operation Transformation Participant)
Night 2: Tuesday January 14th at 8.30pm. Catherine McCurdy (Manager Wexford Women’s Refuge): Domestic Violence; Oisin McConville (Wicklow Footbal Manager): Gambling Addiction
Night 3: Tuesday January 21st at 7.30pm. Christopher Joyce (Coach Wicklow Football Team): Alcohol Addiction; John Kinsella, Ger Byrne and Pat Lacey (Chairman Wexford Parkinson’s Association, Parkinson’s Local Insights.
Night 4: Tuesday January 28th at 7.30pm. Catherine O’Leary and Laurence Cullen (Alzheimer’s Association):Challenges of Dementia Michael Fortune: Local Folklore, Songs from Alyth McCormack
Admission for each night is €10 or €25 for all four nights. Refreshments Served. Contact 085 2156848.
Join Tomnafinnoge AC
Track & Field Coaches and New Members Wanted! Are you inspired by the recent Olympic Games? Do you want to unleash your potential in track & field? Tomnafinnoge Athletics Club is recruiting across all age groups and skill levels!
We are seeking: Juveniles (8-18 years); Seniors (18+ years); Masters (35+ years).
Plus, we’re looking for Coaches with a passion for developing the next generation of athletes!
Whether you’re aiming for your personal best, the podium, or simply enjoying the sport, there’s a place for you at Tomnafinnoge Athletics Club. Training includes: Sprints, Distance running, Jumps & throws, Strength & conditioning.
All levels welcome! From beginners to experienced athletes.
Join us now and be part of something extraordinary! For more details and to register, contact us via our Facebook page or email us tomnafinnogeac@gmail.com
GAA club dinner dance
We are excited to invite you to our Dinner Dance on Saturday 11th January in the Arklow Bay Hotel, with music by Fusion, tickets €45.
We are celebrating not one, not two but eight winning teams from 2024. How many clubs can say they have eight adult trophies brought back to their club within one year?!
We are super excited to celebrate the amazing achievements that we accomplished this year from winning leagues and championships!
Our winners who will be getting their medals: Senior Hurling League, Intermediate LGFA Championship, Intermediate Football League, Intermediate Football Championship, Junior Hurling League, Junior Hurling Championship, Junior Camogie Shield, U19 Hurling Championship.
If you have yet to order your tickets please do so as soon as possible to Niamh, Aoife or Christina.
COOLGREANY
New Year Greetings
We would like to wish all our readers of the local notes a very Happy New Year and a big thanks for all your contributions over the past year, and look forward to a successful 2025. With more notes of interest to all our readers.
Coolgreany Tidy Towns
Coolgreany Tidy Town and Croghan View Residents would like to wish a very happy and healthy New Year to all volunteers who help during the year, to our Fas workers and supervisor to Wexford Co Council and all the businesses that look after the village during the year - a sincere thanks to you all only for your support we would not be able to carry on.
Community Alert.
Since the arrival of the snow and frost we are appealing to be on the lookout for your neighbours in this testing time, especially be aware of your neighbours who may be living alone and need a small bit of support through this bad spell of weather.
Good wishes to all members of our community who maybe in Hospital or are convalescing at home at present, we wish all of them a speedy recovery to full health.
Birthdays
Birthday greetings to Callum Whitmore, Croghan View who celebrates his 16th birthday on 13th January; also birthday greetings to Labhaoise Power, Coolgreany Demesne who celebrates her 17th birthday on 14th January.
Golden Circle
Golden Circle social group are holding a A.G.M. on 13th January at 8pm in Arus Lorcan - all are welcome.
GAA Healthy Club
Castletown Liam Mellows Healthy Club update.
Ireland Lights up starts 8th January on the walking track in Castletown 7-8pm. 100 days of walking self motivated also starts 8th for those who want to work on their own but would like to join a WhatsApp group for accountability & that little bit of motivation.
Activator pole walking continues every Thursday at 11am at the walking track in Castletown.
Other ongoing activities: Yoga with Aislinn Tuesday 7.30pm; Chair Yoga Wednesday 11am-12 noon; Circuits Tuesday and Thursday 8am, Saturday 9.30am Dad’s & Lads Monday 7pm in Arena.
Watch this space for: Nutrition for young athletes; Ball for All; Mothers & Others; Trip down memory Lane.
For more information on the above contact Liz at 086 3879321, Mandy 086 1931324 orr any of Healthy Club team.
Scoil Íosagáín enrolments
Coolgreany National School are now accepting enrolments for September 2025. We are a vibrant, welcoming school community who advocate a growth mindset for all. Check out our Facebook page at Scoil Íosagáin Coolgreany to see the great work that happens in our school each day. Our annual Admissions Notice, our Admission Policy and our enrolment forms are available on our website www.coolgreanyns.ie.
If you would like to enrol your child or know of any parents looking to enrol their children in our school please contact us by phoning 0402) 37246 or 085) 8570276 or email us at office@coolgreanyns.ie and we can send an enrolment form home. The enrolment form can be completed and should be returned to the school as soon as possible to guarantee your child’s place.
Local notes
Please forward all notes for the local papers to Dan by 6 p.m. on Sunday evening. Email danken9@gmail.com or phone 087 4605166.
TINAHELY
Tinahely Craft market
Happy New Year to our customers from us all at the Tinahely Craft market. Thank you for your support throughout 2024. We will be open on Saturdays only for the month of January then business as usual. Our delicious range of biscuits will be back in stock along with all the fabulous locally produced crafts. Opening hours are 10am-4pm.
Events at Tinahely Library
Writers’ Group - Meeting Wednesdays 8th January and 22nd January at 11am. Are you interested in writing? Are you a writer who’s looking for a little companionship, encouragement, feedback and advice from likeminded people? Then come and join our Writers’ Group at Tinahely Library. Any skill level welcome.
Adult Book Club - Meet first Tuesday and first Thursday of the month at 7pm. Discover new books – chosen by the members. Relax and enjoy the discussion.
Baby & Toddler Storytime - Every Wednesday at 10 a.m. Stories, rhymes, songs, play and colouring.
Vincent’s Community Shop
Vincent’s Community Shop is located on Barton Street to the front of the Fairgreen Resource Centre, the shop opens Tuesday to Saturday from 11am to 4pm daily. It offers a wide range of household goods, quality clothes, along with a host of other items ranging from giftware to books and vintage items.
Tinahely Toastmasters
Hone your Public Speaking, Communication & Leadership skills with us! We are an official Toastmasters International Club. Join our next meeting free as a guest. We meet 7.45pm to 9.45pm on the 2nd & 4th Thursday of every month. Contact 087 2786503 for more information.
Your news
If you have an upcoming event in the Tinahely area and surrounds. Please email details to us at tinahelynotes@gmail.com. It’s a great way for people to see your event.
